file_content.text: I don't think we have anything further to discuss.
My lord! You honor me with your presence. How may I serve you?
Good day, agent. How can I be of assistance to you?
Yes, yes, what is it? I'm a busy man, state your business.
I found all of the bodies in the village, Captain. Don't deny that you're the one responsible.
I know what you did.
Those villagers wanted to share their supplies, but you put your personal vendetta above your duty.
You betrayed the Empire.
You butchered innocent people, Captain. And you're going to pay for it.
Quiet, murderer.
You... I... I assure you, this is all just a--just a misunderstanding.
The villagers, you see... they deceived us. They--they ambushed us, and we had to kill them.
No impropriety, nothing personal in what happened. I simply did my duty.
We can keep this simple, can't we? You can forget whatever it is you think you saw, and I can forget about leaving these credits sitting on my desk. Agreed?
Turn yourself in, or I'll take matters into my own hands.
No, I won't take your bribe.
You... leave me no choice, then. S--so be it.
Colonel Adun? This is Captain Varmett.
Yes, Captain?
I... wasn't entirely truthful, when I told you what happened with the supply drop-off....
You can consider everything forgotten, Captain.
Yes, that sounds good.
Yes, well, excellent. I, uh, I won't keep you any longer, then. Good day to you.
I'm sorry, but I'm rather busy at the moment.
